intro: Mcneillia graminifolia subsp. graminifolia, commonly known as the slender leaved Mcneillia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its genus, with specific morphological traits that aid in its identification.
